intro: Daucosma laciniata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved carrot. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments, such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, and it produces small, rounded fruits. The plant has a taproot that is often used in traditional herbal medicine.
